bestBHT.bht: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of our Saviour. It is good and acceptable to God that we should pray for all people. He desires their salvation, and hence it is agreeable to him that we should pray for it. More would be converted if we would pray more. The title Saviour is chosen as belonging to the matter in hand. He has actually saved us who believe, being our Saviour. He is willing that all should be saved, even those who do not as yet believe, if they will believe.

Henry Alford: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of our Saviour."
The making prayers, &c. for all men... is good and acceptable.
The title 'Saviour' is chosen as belonging to the matter in hand.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: More would be converted if we would pray more.
He has actually saved us who believe, being 'our Saviour.'
He is willing that all should be saved, even those who do not as yet believe, if they will believe.
Albert Barnes: It is good and acceptable to God that we should pray for all people.
He desires their salvation, and hence it is agreeable to him that we should pray for it.
If there were no provision made for their salvation, or if he was unwilling that they should be saved, it could not be agreeable to him that we should offer prayer for them.
Marvin Vincent: Acceptable [αποδεκτον] Past o. Compare ajpodoch acceptation, ch. 1 15, and Paul 's eujrosdektov acceptable, Romans 14:16, Romans 14:31; 2 Corinthians 6:2; 2 Corinthians 7:12.
John Calvin: The true rule for acting well and properly is to look to the will of God, and not to undertake anything but what he approves.
There is likewise laid down a rule for godly prayer, that we should follow God as our leader, and that all our prayer should be regulated by his will and command.
If due force had been allowed to this argument, the prayers of Papists, in the present day, would not have abounded with so many corruptions.
Philip Schaff: 1 Timothy 2:3. Acceptable. This and the kindred word rendered by ‘acceptation’ are peculiar to this Epistle.
God our Saviour. The Greek order is more expressive, ‘ our Saviour, God.’
Archibald T. Robertson: Acceptable (αποδεκτον). Late verbal adjective from αποδεχομα. In inscriptions and papyri. In N.T. only here and 1 Timothy 5:4.
John Gill: Not only to live peaceably and quietly under the government men are, since that is the ordination of God...
...to live soberly, righteously, and godly, which his grace teaches...
...to pray for all sorts of men, and for those who are set in the highest place of government, even though enemies and persecutors...
John Wesley: Do you ask, 'Why are not more converted?' We do not pray enough.
It is strange that any whom he has actually saved should doubt the universality of his grace!

bhtAttempts.bht: For this is good and acceptable in the sight of our Saviour. It is good and acceptable to God that we should pray for all people. He desires their salvation, and hence it is agreeable to him that we should pray for it. More would be converted if we would pray more. The title 'Saviour' is chosen as belonging to the matter in hand. He has actually saved us who believe, being 'our Saviour.' He is willing that all should be saved, even those who do not as yet believe, if they will believe. The true rule for acting well and properly is to look to the will of God, and not to undertake anything but what he approves. There is likewise laid down a rule for godly prayer, that we should follow God as our leader, and that all our prayer should be regulated by his will and command.

For this is good and acceptable in the sight of our Saviour. It is good and acceptable to God that we should pray for all people. He desires their salvation, and hence it is agreeable to him that we should pray for it. More would be converted if we would pray more. The title Saviour is chosen as belonging to the matter in hand. He has actually saved us who believe, being our Saviour. He is willing that all should be saved, even those who do not as yet believe, if they will believe.

Praying for all people is good and acceptable in the sight of our Saviour. God desires the salvation of all and it is agreeable to Him that we should pray for it. The title Saviour emphasizes His role in saving us. He is willing to save all, including those who do not yet believe, if they will have faith. We should be diligent in our prayers, trusting in God's will and command, for this is the proper way to act and seek His guidance.

Praying for all people is good and acceptable in the sight of our Saviour. More would be converted if we would pray more. The title 'Saviour' is chosen as belonging to the matter in hand. He has actually saved us who believe, being 'our Saviour.' He is willing that all should be saved, even those who do not as yet believe, if they will believe. We should follow God as our leader and regulate our prayers by His will and command.

Praying for all people is good and acceptable to God, our Saviour. More conversions would occur if we prayed more. The title 'Saviour' highlights His role in saving us. He is willing to save all, even those who have yet to believe, if they will believe. We should follow God as our leader and let our prayers be guided by His will and command. This proper way of acting is demonstrated through living peaceably, righteously, and godly, which His grace teaches us.
